theApp

public static Scriptable theApp

Method Detail

DEFINE_CONSTANT

public static void DEFINE_CONSTANT(com.conceptwave.scripting.Object[] param)
Defines global constants for the JavaScript interpreter

Parameters:
param - List of two or more parameters. The number of parameters must be even number. The first parameter of the pair is a string specifying constant name and should be valid JavaScript identifier. We strongly recommend the constant names to be uppercase with underscore as word separator. The second parameter of the pair is the constant value which can be any object. The API will throw generic exception DE0999 if the number of parameters is 0 or odd number or the first parameter in the pair is not a string. The API will throw exception too if the constant name already exists and has another value.

debugPrintf

public static void debugPrintf(String format,
                               com.conceptwave.scripting.Object[] obj)
Prints line on the system output console. Used for debugging purposes only. Works only if the system is running on debug log level for scripts. The output from the debugPrintf calls can be temporarily redirected to internal stream.

Parameters:
format - Format string as defined for Java 'printf' method
obj - Any number of atomic parameters of any type

Parameters:
obj - Any type of object. The line will contain the value of obj.toString().

printfCategory

public static void printfCategory(String category,
                                  String format,
                                  com.conceptwave.scripting.Object[] obj)
Writes a formatted data (using Java printf format string) on the system output console or in the current verbose file (if set through JMX or PE command line). Used for debugging purposes. Works only if the current user is allowed to print the specified category. The list of the users who are allowed to print as well as the categories they are allowed to use can be viewed and set by JMX using listPrintCategories, addPrintCategories and removePrintCategories methods. The method will print if: 1) The current user ID is allowed for the given category. 2) "All users" user is allowed for the current category. 3) The current user is allowed for "All categories" category. 4) "All users" user is allowed for "All categories" category.

Parameters:
category - A category name. Should start with letter and be at lest one character long. If incorrect the API will throw exception "DE0460"
format - Format string as defined for Java 'printf' method. Note that the API does not insert automatically a new line character at the end.
obj - Any number of parameters of any type as long as they correspond to the format string.

publishEvent

public static com.conceptwave.scripting.Object publishEvent(String event,
                                                            com.conceptwave.scripting.Object mode,
                                                            com.conceptwave.scripting.Object thisObject,
                                                            com.conceptwave.scripting.Object[] parameters)
Publishes an event which will result in calling all scripts subscribed for this event. If no scripts are subscribed for the event the API will exit without doing anything.

Parameters:
event - The name of the event. Should be unique in the application
mode - The script execution mode. Can be one of the following: SYNCH - all subscribed scripts will be called synchronously one after another. ASYNC - all subscribed scripts will be called asynchronously in parallel threads. FIRST_ONE - all subscribed scripts will be called synchronously one after another until the first one which returns not null value or script id from the subscriber list in which case the script with the specified id (if found) will be called. PROPRAGATE - the result of the previously executed subscribed script is passed as the first parameter to the next subscribed script. The order of execution of the subscribed scripts is not guaranteed. This mode is useful for accumulating the results of subscribed scripts. A string - Which represents the event id of the event handler. This will restrict only event handlers of the given event id to handle the event.
thisObject - The 'this' object of the script. May be null.
parameters - Zero, one or more parameters to be passed to the subscribed script(s).
Returns:
The return value depends on the mode: For SYNCH and ASYNCH mode - Boolean.TRUE if there is at least one script executed, otherwise Boolean.FALSE For FIRST_ONE mode - First non-null value of the subscribed scripts. Otherwise returns null For PROPRAGATE mode - Return value of the last executed script. For any of the modes If no scripts are subscribed for the event the return value will be null

runscript

public static com.conceptwave.scripting.Object runscript(String name,
                                                         String searchType,
                                                         com.conceptwave.scripting.Object thisObject,
                                                         com.conceptwave.scripting.Object[] parameters)
Executes external script and returns the result

Parameters:
name - The external script name
searchType - The external script search type. If a two character string it should not start with characters 'a', 'b', 'c' and '$'. The content of this string is not checked by the API.
thisObject - The script 'this' object. Must be scriptable object (not simple data type). If not the API will throw exception "DE0999: Invalid 'this' object"
parameters - Optional script parameters. Can be more than one
Returns:
The result of the execution of the external script.

runscriptVersion

public static com.conceptwave.scripting.Object runscriptVersion(Date versionTime,
                                                                String name,
                                                                String searchType,
                                                                com.conceptwave.scripting.Object thisObject,
                                                                com.conceptwave.scripting.Object[] parameters)
Executes external script version for a given time and returns the result. The time will be usde to find a particular version which may not be the current (or latest) version of the script.

Parameters:
versionTime - The time for which a valid script version is found. If null the current time is used.
name - The external script name
searchType - The external script search type. If a two character string it should not start with characters 'a', 'b', 'c' and '$'. The content of this string is not checked by the API.
thisObject - The script 'this' object. Must be scriptable object (not simple data type). If not the API will throw exception "DE0999: Invalid 'this' object"
parameters - Optional script parameters. Can be more than one
Returns:
The result of the execution of the external script.

setSessionCurrent

public static void setSessionCurrent(String name,
                                     com.conceptwave.scripting.Object value)
Sets a session parameter value. Each session maintains a list of parameter/value pairs. The names of the parameters are not predefined. If the parameter does not exist it is added. If it exists its value is changed correspondingly. This API is functionally equivalent to the Global.setSessionParameter API but throws exception if used in PE mode.

Parameters:
name - Parameter name.
value - Parameter value.

subscribeForEvent

public static void subscribeForEvent(String script,
                                     String event,
                                     String id)
Registers a global or external script as a subscriber for the given event

Parameters:
script - Full specification of a metadata global script or short form of external script specification.
event - The event name. Should be unique in the application
id - The script id. Unique for the event. If null or not specified the script will be added to the subscriber list. If not null the script will be added to the list if no script with the same id exists in the list. Otherwise the script will replace the existing script with same id in the list.
